questions.question: The thief jumped ........................ the wall.
questions.description: Over is used to say on or to the other side of something high.

questions.question: She sat .............................. her son and daughter.
questions.description: Use between to talk about two people or things.

questions.question: We drove ............................. the tunnel.
questions.description: Use through for movement within spaces where there are things all around.

questions.question: Why are you staring ............................. me?
questions.description: Use at with look, stare etc.

questions.question: They took over a week to cross the Atlantic ............................... a ship.
questions.description: We use on with bus, train, plane and ship.

questions.question: Who is that pretty girl .............................. the second row?
London is ........................... river Thames.
questions.description: Use on to show position on a line.

questions.question: You should never run ............................... the road.
questions.description: Across shows movement from one side to the other side.

questions.question: I first met him .............................. a department store.
questions.description: In shows position inside. Use at with proper nouns.

questions.question: It has been ages ............................... I heard anything from her.
questions.description: Use since with the starting point.
